content:
Interesting Microsoft telling you about other applications having their own procedures and me first pointing you to their requirements to connect hey. But they like to deny responsibility.

First you need to make sure your incoming and outgoing server are as shown in this page https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/office/pop-imap-and-smtp-settings-for-outlook-com-d088b986-291d-42b8-9564-9c414e2aa040

Then, if you have to change the server names restart Thunderbird and return to the account settings. Change the authentication method to oauth in the incoming account and the outgoing server (SMTP) entry.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: well what is the response from iinet about why your ability to send mail has been blocked. I am not a customer, so I have no idea what they consider abuse.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: It is simply, your recipients is paying this mob, antispamcloud (see https://my.azym.com/index.php/knowledgebase/39/Manage-AntispamCloud.html) to block and refuse spam emails. They have identified your mail as spam. I suggest you address your issues to the company blocking or your correspondents. There is certainly nothing that can be done here.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Se si tratta di caselle gestite da Aruba, un utente ha segnalato che la richiesta della password è dovuta alla sincronizzazione del calendario e non alla casella di posta in se. L'informazione gli è stata girata dal supporto di Aruba. Qui i dettagli -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1451357

content: Are they visible on old PC? what version of thunderbird on old pc? what version on new? If old is 115 or earlier and new is 128, then my suggestion for now is to reinstall 115 on new pc for compatibility. 128 is currently rolling out and your blank messages may be related.
creator: davidsk

content: They're not visible on both PC. Old PC is windows 7 Thunderbird version 115.9.0 and New Pc Windows 11 Thunderbird version 115.13.0.
creator: Laila667

content: I suggest a folder repair: highlight folder, rightclick and select properties and then select repair. Do this on the new PC. You might also highlight a selected message and press cntl and 'u' to see raw source of message to see if user content is present.
creator: davidsk

content:
I suggest reverting to 115.13. That may not be it, but 128 has just begun rollout. tens of thousands have installed it, but I'd rather be safe. You can get 115 at this url (I'm guessing English and 64-bit windows) https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.13.0/win64/en-US/ If yo u use Linux or Mac or win-32, you can select here: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.13.0/

I would install over the top of current installation and there may be a compatibilities.ini file in profile to delete. If that works, please let me know. Thanks.
